intro: Lathyrus brachycalyx var. eucosmus, commonly known as the short-calyx larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and showy, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its striking blue or purple blossoms. It has a short growing season and produces small, pod-like fruits containing several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
